name: php-build
body:
# php-build

php-build builds multiple PHP versions from source, and this _fully automatic_.

## Who uses this?

 * [Travis CI](http://travis-ci.org)
 * _Maybe you?_

## Install

```
% git clone git://github.com/CHH/php-build
% cd php-build
% sudo ./install.sh
```

## Usage

### Synopsis

```
php-build --help
php-build --definitions
php-build [-i <environment_or_inifile>] <definition> <prefix>
```

Before you can build PHP you will need all necessary build dependencies. 

If you happen to use Ubuntu then this is done with one command:

```
% sudo apt-get build-dep php5-cli
```

Then run this to install PHP 5.4.2 in development configuration:

```
% php-build -i development 5.4.2 ~/local/php/5.4.2
```

To get a list of all supported PHP versions pass the `--definitions` flag:

```
% php-build --definitions
```

By default PHP versions come only with Pyrus (the new Pear installer) preinstalled.
Pass the `--pear` flag to enable the legacy Pear installer alongside of Pyrus for enhanced
compatibility with legacy Pear packages:

```
% php-build -i development --pear 5.4.2 ~/local/php/5.4.2
```
